Questions.QuestionString: 1. Which of these barometric instruments uses a restrictor to compute its output?. (Level 1)
2. Where is the spinup/rundown brake on a gyro instrument?. (Level 1)
3. In Airways flying, what is the barometric scale of the altimeter set to?. (Level 1)
4. Vibration monitoring signals are sent. (Level 1)
Answers: A. via a signal conditioner to the gauge.
B. via a half-wave rectifier to the gauge.

Questions.QuestionString: 5. The vacuum system gauge reads 5 inches of mercury. This is from. (Level 1)
6. The hot junction of thermocouple is. (Level 1)
7. Pitot tubes are heated. (Level 1)
8. The suction gauge reads 5 inches of mercury. This is. (Level 1)
9. What are the primary colours for use in CRT displays?. (Level 1)
10. Track altitude in a radio altimeter system begins at. (Level 1)
11. What is the maximum radio altimeter track altitude?. (Level 1)
12. The runway heading is. (Level 1)
13. Apparent drift of a vertical gyro is a function of. (Level 1)
14. A machmeter works. (Level 1)
Answers: C. always except on the ground.

Questions.QuestionString: 15. Radio marker information is displayed on. (Level 1)
16. Angle of Attack alarm is sounding too close to stall. Rectification is to. (Level 1)
17. Where is alpha angle used?. (Level 1)

18. Alpha vane signal could be fed to _________________ ________________ when close
to stall. (Level 1)
19. The HSI provides information on. (Level 1)
Answers: A. VOR, ILS, map, radar, attitude.
B. VOR, plan, map, ILS, radar.

Questions.QuestionString:
20. In a compass swing: North error -2 degrees, South error - 2 degrees. The coefficient C is.
(Level 1)

21. When aligning an aircraft for a compass swing, the maximum allowable error is. (Level
1)

22. The pitot head is fitted on the aircraft. The alignment of pitot head is carried out with.
(Level 1)
23. What kind of gyro is a rate gyro?. (Level 1)
24. A radio altimeter system can be self tested. (Level 1)
Answers: A. both on the ground only and in the air.

Questions.QuestionString: 25. The apparent wander for directional gyros is. (Level 1)
Answers: A. compensated by applying a constant torque.

Questions.QuestionString: 26. The Directional Gyro is checked every 15 minutes for. (Level 1)
27. Coefficient A is adjusted. (Level 1)
28. Which pitot probe provides information to the captains instruments?. (Level 1)
29. On the CWP, what does amber indicate?. (Level 1)
30. Which instrument shows Decision Height?. (Level 1)
31. Where does the HSI receive GND speed information from?. (Level 1)
32. When power is switched off, the gimbal brake. (Level 1)
33. What deviation is indicated by 2 dots in a VOR system?. (Level 1)
34. An RMI has inputs from VOR and. (Level 1)
35. In a modern HSI, the displays are. (Level 1)
36. At what height does the rising runway appear?. (Level 1)
37. An H on the EHSI indicates. (Level 1)
38. Compared to air driven gyros, the electric gyro runs. (Level 1)
39. A pneumatic indicator takes its indications from. (Level 1)
40. What is apparent drift due to?. (Level 1)
41. How does a machmeter work?. (Level 1)
Answers: B. True airspeed and speed of sound.

Questions.QuestionString: 42. If rate feedback in a flight director goes open circuit, position indication will. (Level 1)
43. An ECAM system is tested under the following conditions:-. (Level 2)
Answers: A. Aircraft on the ground with one engine running.
B. Aircraft in the air with both engines running.
C. Aircraft on the ground with parking brake set/on.

Questions.QuestionString:
44. Which instrument are most likely to damage if you have a rapid drop in pressure, when
carrying out a pitot-static leak check?. (Level 2)
45. On replacing a pre-indexed flux valve you would. (Level 2)
Answers: A. align the aircraft onto its A coefficient so that no error is induced.

B. fit the serviceable pre indexed flux valve into the same position as the unserviceable pre
indexed flux valve was removed from.
C. carry out a check swing after fitment.

Questions.QuestionString: 46. A direct reading Bourdon gauge has a restriction in the inlet. This is to. (Level 2)
47. When a rad. alt. reaches 2,500 ft. what happens to the display?. (Level 2)
Answers: A. Rad. alt. flag in view.
B. Rad. alt. goes out of view.

Questions.QuestionString:
48. When performing maintenance operations on an aircraft equipped with RVSM system,
and a quick release disconnect connection is disturbed. (Level 2)
Answers: A. a full test of the system should be carried out.

B. a full test of the system should be carried out only if the aircraft manufacturer
recommends to do so.
C. the allowances for the system should be halved.

Questions.QuestionString:
49. For aircraft certificated after 1997 and with RVSM, the maximum tolerance for the
system would be. (Level 2)
Answers: A. +/- 300 feet plus +/- 50 feet for instrument errors.
B. +/- 500 feet for the system overall.
C. +/- 200 feet plus +/- 50 feet for instrument error.

Questions.QuestionString: 50. The sensing element of the flux valve. (Level 2)
Answers: A. aligns itself to the new heading as the aircraft turns.
B. remains in the same position attached to the aircraft structure.
C. aligns itself to the new heading of the aircraft after it has stabilised.

Questions.QuestionString: 51. Random drift of a gyro is caused by. (Level 2)
Answers: A. error in roll when aircraft is turning.
B. aircraft turning with an error in roll.

Questions.QuestionString:
52. Standby Compass adjusting magnets (Flinders Bars) exert the most amount of
influence. (Level 2)
Answers: B. when parallel to each other.

Questions.QuestionString: 53. With engine static and engine blanks fitted, EPR gauge reads just above 1. (Level 2)
54. With an aircraft which has more than one compass system. (Level 2)
Answers: A. master adjusted, slave adjusted, each having a corrected compass card.
B. both are adjusted on each heading.
C. master and slave adjusted, correction card for master only.

Questions.QuestionString: 55. A DC electrical cable must be positioned how far away from a compass?. (Level 2)
Answers: C. So as to give no more than 2 degrees deflection of compass.

Questions.QuestionString: 56. On an EADI the command bars show the. (Level 2)
Answers: A. required flight path compared with horizon.
B. required flight path compared with aircraft position.
C. required flight path compared to planned flight path.

Questions.QuestionString: 57. The airdata computer inputs to. (Level 2)
Answers: B. mach meter, standby altimeter, ASI.
C. cabin rate sensors, mach-meters, ASI, altimeter.

Questions.QuestionString: 58. How may the basic principle of the radio altimeter be described?. (Level 2)
Answers:
A. As a series of radio pulses to the ground their frequency depending on the expansion or
contraction of an evacuated capsule and the deflection of an E and I bar transducer.

B. As a comparison of radio altitude against a barometric altitude referenced to ISA sea level
(1013.25mb).

C. As a measure of the time between a RF pulse transmission and the reception of its echo
from the ground directly below the aircraft.

Questions.QuestionString:
59. In a compass system, what senses the horizontal component of the earths magnetic
field and where is it normally fitted?. (Level 2)
Answers: A. Directional gyro mounted on the roll axis of the aircraft.
B. A precession device mounted on the yaw axis of the aircraft.
C. Flux detectors fitted in the wing tips.

Questions.QuestionString: 60. An aircraft airspeed indicator has. (Level 2)
Answers: C. pitot to the capsule and static to the out side of the capsule.

Questions.QuestionString: 61. Above 2500 ft. the rad. Alt. (Level 2)
Answers: A. pointer is hidden behind a mask with off flag out of view.
B. continues to indicate but with a warning flag.
C. pointer goes to zero to show system is being monitored.

Questions.QuestionString: 62. When changing a pitot static instrument with quick release couplings. (Level 2)
Answers: A. a leak check is not required.
B. a leak check is always required.
C. a leak check is only required if stated by manufacturer.

Questions.QuestionString: 63. The flux detector element. (Level 2)
Answers: A. gives heading with respect to magnetic north.
B. changes heading with the heading of the aircraft.
C. changes it position after the aircraft heading is changed.

Questions.QuestionString: 64. If the compass fluid has bubbles at low altitude. (Level 2)
Answers: A. this is due to excessive high cabin altitude flying.
B. this has no influence on compass readings.
C. this is due to insufficient de-aeration.

Questions.QuestionString:
65. A remote compass compensator unit is replaced. Which of the following is correct?.
(Level 2)
Answers: A. The swing can be performed at a later date.
B. No swing is required if the new heading is within 5 degrees of the old.
C. A compass swing must be performed.

Questions.QuestionString:
66. A compass has a residual deviation of +1 degree. To steer a true heading of 180 degrees
the pilot must steer. (Level 2)
67. What effect on the rate of precession will a change of gyro rotor speed have?. (Level 2)
Answers: B. Decrease the rotor speed, decrease the rate of precession.
C. Increase the rotor speed, decrease the rate of precession.

Questions.QuestionString: 68. If a constant torque is applied to a gyroscope, the rate of precession. (Level 2)
Answers: A. is unaffected by changes in rotor speed.
B. increases with a higher rotor speed.
C. increases with a lower rotor speed.

Questions.QuestionString: 69. Random drift of a gyro is caused by. (Level 2)
Answers: A. unbalance and bearing friction in the gyro.
C. aircraft turning with an error in roll.

Questions.QuestionString:
70. A pendulous vane type erection system fitted to a gyro horizon works on the principle
of. (Level 2)
Answers: A. increased reaction of the air from a bisected port.
B. decreased reaction of the air from a fully open port.
C. increased reaction of the air from a fully open port.

Questions.QuestionString:
71. During the normal straight and level flight, the gyro of an electrical artificial horizon is
kept erect in pitch by a. (Level 2)
Answers:
A. mercury switch in the fore and aft axis controlling a torque motor fitted between the inner
and outer gimbal rings.

B. torque motor fitted between the outer gimbal ring and the case controlled by a mercury
switch in the athwartships axis.

C. torque motor fitted between the outer gimbal ring and the case controlled by a mercury
switch in the fore and aft axis.

Questions.QuestionString:
72. The normal erection supply to the mercury switches of the artificial horizon is
disconnected. (Level 2)
Answers: A. for the first 40 seconds after initially switching 'ON'.
C. when the fast erection button is pressed.

Questions.QuestionString: 73. The pitch/bank erection system is used in an electrical gyro horizon to. (Level 2)
Answers: A. give full erection control to the roll switch during a turn.
B. give full erection control to the pitch switch during a turn.
C. to prevent the pitch switch giving a false indication due to centrifugal effects during a turn.

Questions.QuestionString:
74. The fast erection push on an electrical gyro horizon must not be used for a set period
after switching on because. (Level 2)
Answers: A. excessive hunting will take place.
B. overheating of the gyro rotor windings will occur.
C. the normal erection switch contact will burn out.

Questions.QuestionString: 75. The erection system on a directional gyroscope has. (Level 2)
Answers: A. a switch on the outer gimbal controlling a motor on the inner gimbal.
B. a switch on the inner gimbal controlling a motor on the inner gimbal.
C. a switch on the inner gimbal controlling a motor on the outer gimbal.

Questions.QuestionString:
76. In a rate gyro used to detect movements about a vertical axis, the amount the gimbal
ring moves would be increased if the. (Level 2)
Answers: A. angle through which the gyro moves in azimuth increases.

Questions.QuestionString: 77. In a Turn and Slip indicator, the effect of increasing the rotor speed would be. (Level 2)
Answers: A. it would have no effect.

Questions.QuestionString: 78. How is the information on a directional gyro outer gimbal taken off?. (Level 2)
Answers: A. By a switch on the outer gimbal.
B. By a switch on the inner gimbal.
C. By a flux take-off device.

Questions.QuestionString: 79. Why is a directional gyro inner gimbal restricted to +/- 85º?. (Level 2)
Answers: A. To ensure outer gimbal erection system works correctly.
B. To prevent outer gimbal rotating.
C. To prevent gyro going into gimbal lock.

Questions.QuestionString: 80. The electrolyte switches used in gyro systems rely upon. (Level 2)
Answers: A. change in inductance to operate.
B. change in resistance to operate.
C. change in voltage applied to operate.

Questions.QuestionString: 81. Angular momentum of a gyro rotor depends on. (Level 2)
Answers: A. angular velocity of the rotor.
B. moment of inertia of the rotor.
C. moment of inertia and angular velocity of the rotor.

Questions.QuestionString: 82. Gyro precessional force is. (Level 2)
Answers: A. inversely proportional to the applied force.
B. directly proportional to applied force.
C. proportional to the square of the applied force.

Questions.QuestionString: 83. With a V.S.I. pointer at position 1 on the upper half of the scale it indicates. (Level 2)

84. After disconnecting the supply to an electrically operated gyro instrument it is
recommended that, to allow the gyro rotor to stop, before moving the instrument. (Level
2)
